tool_arguments.command:
```python
from sympy import *
def solution():
  x1, y1, x2, y2 = 546, 404, 593, 459
  gsd = 0.9666
  px = 50 / gsd
  cx = (x1 + x2) / 2
  cy = (y1 + y2) / 2
  new_x1 = round(cx - px)
  new_y1 = round(cy - px)
  new_x2 = round(cx + px)
  new_y2 = round(cy + px)
  return str((new_x1, new_y1, new_x2, new_y2))
```

According to the National Safety Council, a safe following distance is at least 3 seconds behind the vehicle in front of you. At 60 mph, this equates to approximately 264 feet or about 80 meters.

    centroids.append(((88+180)/2, (532+614)/2))
    centroids.append(((226+338)/2, (211+302)/2))
    centroids.append(((378+458)/2, (23+98)/2))
    return str(centroids)
```

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def solution():
    labels = ['Flooded', 'Non-Flooded']
    data = [1, 5]
    fig = plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.pie(data, labels=labels, autopct='%1.1f%%', startangle=90)
    plt.axis('equal')
    plt.title('Flooded vs Non-Flooded Houses')
    return fig
```

tool_arguments.command:
```python
from sympy import *
def solution():
  x1, y1, x2, y2 = 546, 404, 593, 459
  gsd = 0.9666
  px = 50 / gsd
  cx = (x1 + x2) / 2
  cy = (y1 + y2) / 2
  new_x1 = round(cx - px)
  new_y1 = round(cy - px)
  new_x2 = round(cx + px)
  new_y2 = round(cy + px)
  return str((new_x1, new_y1, new_x2, new_y2))
```
